title: ATM, Overdraft Fees Pile Up
teaser: A new survey shows that bank fees rose this past year and overwhelmingly burden lower-income customers.
contentencoded:
Banks are making more money from customers who overspend and use out-of-network ATMs.

A survey from Bankrate.com shows ATM fees have gone up 5 percent in the past year.

Charges for overdrafting a checking account have also hit a new record high for the 16th straight year.

These fees can burden lower-income customers and make it harder for them to save.

NPR’s Marilyn Geewax  joins Here & Now‘s Robin Young to discuss these rising fees and how it is affecting customers.

Guest

  • Marilyn Geewax, senior business editor for NPR. She tweets @geewaxnpr.
